page.title: 05FARMING: TROUT.
page.content: Near the water sports centre at Beecraigs loch is the fish farm.It was the first of its kind to be developed by a local authority in Scotland. Visitors to the farm can see the life cycle of the trout in different tanks on most days throughout the year. The trout farm is operated as a working unit and it supplies fish for the table as well as stocking rivers and lochs for other local authority areas and angling clubs. It stocks Beecraigs loch as well. Local schools are made very welcome when they are doing a project on trout.They are shown the early stages of trout life by seeing the eggs and alevins in trays. The visit usually ends with the children being able to feed the trout in the large outside tanks. Herons are a problem.
